page.title: 07Walk by the Essington Canal
page.content: When we got to the Perry Hall Bridge we crossed the road to get to the towpath.There was lots of rubbish in the canal such as tyres,prams and milk crates.The bricks under the canal show that it had been replaced by a new one.On the other side of the canal the land was marshy and there were also some gardens called allotments.Further up the canal there was an overflow and then we came to Pool Hayes Bridge, which we could tell was old because of the brickwork.We then came to a bridge called Knightsbridge which had bricks underneath to stop the horses which used to pull the barges from slipping. In the canal we saw fish such as minnows and sticklebacks and also two swans.We also saw some water-lilies and marsh marigolds.Further up the canal there were some factories which made metal rods.
